title: Derivatives as Rates of Change
body: Assume that the number of barbeque dinners that can be sold, $$x$$, can be related to the price charged, $$p$$, by the equation p(x) $$=$$ $$9$$ - $$0.03x$$, $$0$$ $$ \leq $$ $$x$$ $$ \leq $$ $$300$$. In this case, the revenue in dollars obtained by selling $$x$$ barbeque dinners is given by R(x) $$=$$ xp(x) $$=$$ x(9 - $$0.03x)$$ $$=$$ $$-0.03x^2$$ + $$9x$$ for $$0$$ $$ \leq $$ $$x$$ $$ \leq $$ $$300$$.
